WorkItem.ClosedComment: This is by design unless the file the compiler is complaining about isn't actually in an unsupported file encoding in which case feel free to re-open this issue. As others have alluded to, you likely have some Unicode or other special characters in your file that are causing it to be in some encoding the compiler doesn't understand (perhaps you copied some text out of webpage or Word doc that had smart quotes, foreign characters, etc). You'll need to remove these characters and/or save the file in a supported encoding.
WorkItem.Description:
Hello all,

I am using VS 2012 Ultimate. In a MVC4 project I am using typescript.
I have installed webessentials 2012 and TypeScriptSetup.0.9.5

When I built the project, all of a sudden I got following error.

Build: Cannot read file 'E:\Projects\Solution\Portal\TypeScripts\CommonScripts\file.ts': Unsupported file encoding.

As suggested at http://stackoverflow.com/questions/18205199/typescript-error-web-essential
I uninstalled webEssentials 2012 then uninstalled TypeScriptSetup.0.9.5 and installled TypeScriptSetup.1.0rc
and then webEssentials 2012
Still I am not able to get rid of above error.

Is there any work around? Please let me know ASAP
WorkItem.Summary: TypeScriptSetup.1.0rc - On build Unsupported file encoding

Comments.Message: Have you tried what the top voted answer in the stackoverflow question suggested?
Yes I did try that as well. But it was already set to bin\ folder itself.
I reinstalled VS 2012 but could not get rid of this issue.

Not sure what you mean by the bin\folder etc.

I'm referring to this answer: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/18205199/typescript-error-web-essential#19200567

I believe the problem is you have one or more special symbols somewhere in your file. Try the fix suggested in the link.
